Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: basically in simple words  CC are smart contracts ..just like ethereum has

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is the big problem, people assume this and it is totally incorrect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a single CC could implement solidity

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we have one CC in development that is a JS CC, where you can run javascript

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the CC changes the consensus rules directly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this probably doenst make much sense if you are not a dev...

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: I am  a dev ...go on

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, lets use the rogue CC as an example

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc-jl/introduction.html
you can get a pretty good idea if you go through this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the rogue CC logs the user keystrokes as they play the game and at the end of the game they can submit a claim to the blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which then replays the entire game to see what the result is

Author: jorian#4555
Content: `we have one CC in development that is a JS CC, where you can run javascript` aka LISK

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all nodes do this, so there is no way to forge the data

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and it converts the ingame gold to actual ROGUE coins and the ingame playerdata to NFT

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the NFT can then be bought/sold via the token DEX

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or used in a new game

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: while theoretically you could do this with ETH/solidity, the gas costs would likely be crazy for each game. and long the nodes running rogue need to bother with all the rogue calculations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now rogue is just an example, basically any deterministic random process can use the same methods

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is the heir CC, that is much simpler. it lets you setup an address and an heir. If ever the specified amount of time goes by without you using the address, the heir is able to. no need to refresh things, it automatically adjusts the first block the heir can access the funds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the dilithium CC, which adds the quantum resistant algo for making payments, the consensus rule is changed so you need the dilithium privkey in addition to the normal one to properly sign transactions. the fundamental signature scheme is changed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the trustless oracles, which allows the creation of trustless pricefeeds. that is still in development, but it has many usecases

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with CC you can change the blockchain consensus rule with whatever logic you can conceive of

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i have demonstrated this with the very wide range of initial CC that i have written, but it is of course turing complete, so there is no limit to what can be done

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: channels CC that allows decentralized instant p2p payments (after channel is created)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sudoku CC, tetris CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: rewards CC that emulates the financial behavior of masternodes. so you get what most people want the masternodes for, without any overhead

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: Basically it increase programmability of asset chains ... other than parameters ..CC makes asset chains programmable  ,., also CC can be used as a template to bring in some functionality in your asset chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you are using existing CC, then with just issuing rpc calls you can implement your dapp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you need custom functionality, you can make a dynamically linked in CC with that functionality

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: `Basically CC increase programmability of asset chains ... other than parameters ..CC makes asset chains programmable  ,., also CC can be used as a template (i want payment channel  ..some one already made..i just need to copy paste that CC ) to bring in some functionality in your asset chain` my understanding here is correct?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is easier

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ./komodod -ac_import=KMD -ac_name=SIDECHAIN

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you would just specify on the command line that it it is a sidechain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for the pegs, it would be like ./komodod -ac_name=KUSD -ac_peg=USD -ac_import=KMD

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: edited above

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that would make a chain called KUSD that makes a USD peg, backed by KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ./komodod -ac_name=KCAD -ac_peg=CAD -ac_import=DOGE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CAD stablecoin, backed by DOGE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you just need to use the already existing CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only if you need a custom CC do you need to write any code

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont see it as komodo (the open source project) job to create the finished products, but rather to create the tech that others can use to create the finished products

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: via CC a totally brand  new consensus blockchain can be created, with about 1% the effort of creating something from scratch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there really are not that many different consensus algo to date, PoW, PoS, variations on the same basic ideas, i guess ouroborous, DAG, but really just a few dozen different consensus algorithms

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in the last 6 months, I have made about 20 different blockchain consensus algorithms via CC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: about the same as everybody else combined
